numbered_ace_sentences: 1. I examined the graph.
2. I noticed a pattern in the graph.
3. In almost every country, the percentage of younger people is higher than the percentage of people who are 40+ years old.
4. The question is: Is the world getting better with each generation?
5. This pattern is interesting.
6. This pattern shows that younger people have more optimism than older people.
7. This optimism is optimism about the younger people themselves.
8. This difference could be caused by a bias.
9. The younger group could have a bias toward the younger group.
10. The older group could have a bias toward the older group.
11. Younger people have more confidence in their own generation.
12. Older people believe that older people are better at managing the world.
13. I wonder about Indonesia.
14. I wonder what gave people in Indonesia confidence in the younger generation.
15. In Indonesia, the overall percentage is much higher than in all other countries.
16. I wonder if a specific cause exists for this statistic.
17. This relates to my community.
18. I have noticed a pattern in my community.
19. In my community, many older people are hesitant to be confident in the younger generation.
20. In my community, young people are more confident in the younger generation than older people are.
21. This difference could be due to hope about being young.
22. This difference could be due to another cause.
23. This difference is prevalent in my community.
24. The graph compares two percentages.
25. One percentage is the percentage of young adults who believe that the world is becoming better with each generation.
26. The other percentage is the percentage of people who are 40+ years old and who believe that the world is becoming better with each generation.
27. A catchy headline is: Do older generations have hope in new generations?
